DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MASCARENHAS, L. A. B.;MASCARENHAS, LUIS ALBERTO BREDA;BREDA MASCARENHAS, LUIS ALBERTO

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Doutor em Cincias pelo ITA (2015), mestre em Engenharia Mecnica pela UFSC (2005), nfase em Fabricao/ Processos de Soldagem. Engenheiro Intenacional de Soldagem pelo IIW (International Institute of Welding), (2000). Possui graduao em Engenharia Mecnica pela Universidade Federal da Bahia (1997). Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia Mecnica, com nfase em Processos de Fabricao/ Soldagem. Foi Diretor Regional do SENAI-BA no perodo de junho de 2015 julho de 2018. Atualmente ocupa o cargo de Diretor Adjunto de Tecnologia e Inovao do SENAI-BA/CIMATEC e Vice-reitor do Centro Universitrio SENAI CIMATEC
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Doctor in Science from ITA (2015). Master Degree in Mechanical Engineering from UFSC (2005) in Manufacturing/Welding Process. International Welding Engineer from IIW (International Institute of Welding), (2000). Graduate at Mechanical Engineering from UFBA (1997). Has experience in Mechanical Engineering, focusing on Manufacturing Processes and Welding Process. He was Regional Director of SENAI-BA from June/2015 until July 2018. Nowadays he is the Deputy Director of Innovation and Technology and and Vice-provost of SENAI Bahia/CIMATEC .

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Burnthrough conditions prediction for In-service Wire Feed Gas Tungten Arc Welding

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MASCARENHAS, L. A. B.;MASCARENHAS, LUIS ALBERTO BREDA;BREDA MASCARENHAS, LUIS ALBERTO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work it was studied the application conditions of TIG with wire feeding for the in-service repair of pipelines with small remaining thickness was studied, in order to avoid burnthrough. Experiments in which TIG torch heating was applied on pipes pressurized with argon at 1, 20 and 40 bar, produced burnthrough in the same welding conditions, no matter what the vessel pressure was. For the application of TIG process with wire feeding, the adequate wire speed ranges were determined as a function of heat input, establishing as teh acceptability criteria the arc stability and weld quality. For every heat input, the allowable wire speed range is large, so the process is robust. Tests with deposition by TIG showed that burnthrough does not occurr in 3,2 mm thickness plates with heat inputs lower than 7 kJ/cm. Fillet welds made on overlapped joints with temperatures monitored through thermocouples welded on the surface opposed to the arc showed that maximum temperatures reached are lower than those in bead on pipe welds, so the allowable heat input levels for the welding of sleeves on pipes are higher than those in repairs by weld deposition.
